alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 11:22PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Nebraska, including the following counties, Franklin and Webster. * WHEN...Until 530 AM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1118 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Rabbit Run Creek, Dry Creek, Spring Creek, Willow Creek, Ash Creek, Dove Creek, Thompson Creek, Indian Creek, Elm Creek, Beaver Creek, Center Creek, Little Blue River, Farmers Creek, Minnie Creek, Liberty Creek, Flat Creek, Oak Creek, Crooked Creek, Lovely Creek, Sassacus Creek, and Thompson Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain could result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Campbell, Bladen, Upland, Riverton, and Cowles. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
